definitions.meaning: to lower in rank, office, prestige, or esteem
example: … the shame that had abased him within and without …  — James Joyce

As we enter among them the great elephant makes us a bow in the best style of elephantine courtesy, bending lowly down his mountain bulk, with trunk abased and leg thrust out behind.  — Nathaniel Hawthorne

synonyms_and_antonyms.meaning: cause to feel shame; hurt the pride of

personal_translations.0: 降低(地位、职位、威望或尊严)
